p: The data used in this article is derived from GENNOVATE (Enabling Gender Equality in Agricultural and Environmental Innovation). This is a cross-CGIAR (Consultative Group for International Agricultural Research) initiative examining how interactions between gender norms, agency and other contextual factors shape access to, adoption of and benefits from agricultural innovations in rural communities worldwide (see more details on the Gennovate methodology in Petesch, Badstue, and Prain [2018]). Data collection in Bangladesh took place in 2015.
